data.title: Quick & Classic
data.text: Great Burger & Fries and All American Diner.  We've been for Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner.  Meets all generations of eaters.  Never disappoints.  Love the easy atmosphere and Quick meal.  Feels like "Happy Days" throw back....

data.title: Lunch at John's
data.text: Everything is good here but try the tacos the best! Breakfast is good too! Hamburgers big and tasty!

data.title: The pastrami sandwich will not leave room for pie
data.text: Just visiting Tustin so had never eaten her previously. The pastrami sandwich was good and BIG so I did not have room for pie. The couple in the next booth were having pie and reported that it was VERY GOOD.

data.title: Bountiful Breakfast Burrito!
data.text: This morning I awoke wanting some Hash Brown Potatoes.  So often they are cooked after being taking right out of the freezer and then plopped onto a grill.  When cooked that way they are often crispy (even sometimes burnt) on the outside, but still raw in the center.  What to do?  The decision I made was to order them inside a breakfast burrito at John's.  If they turned out to be bad, why, then I would just eat everything else.  When the HUGE item was delivered by my seat I opened it up with a knife and fork . . . perfect.  The potatoes were cooked just right, and all the way through.  A delightful experience.

data.title: Nice comfortable casual restaurant with reliable and tasty food
data.text:
My family really likes John's Place.  We've been going there for a couple years now.  Went to the one in Orange before this one was opened.  This one is closer and never packed.

Food is of a standard American variety - hamburgers, ham/turkey/steak sandwiches, hot/corn dogs, some chicken, fries, very good onion rings, some Mexican food, decent salad bar, and more.  Their breakfast menu is standard eggs, hash browns, omelettes, bacon/sausage, pancakes etc.  Soda/tea/coffee is all you can drink.  They make excellent breakfast burritos!

The food is tasty and we've rarely been disappointed.  Prices are fair.  You order at the counter and they bring the food to your table.  The staff has always been nice and will modify your meal a little if you need them to.  (If they can do it.)

We meet up with friends there when we just want a nice place to sit for a while and chat.  I'll go there with my wife on my Friday's off for a casual breakfast without the kids.  

We definitely recommend it!

data.title: A great alternative to fast food chain restaurants.
data.text:
When I’m driving around town and have a craving for fast food, I prefer to avoid the big chains and patronize locally-owned businesses.  You generally get more for your money, because that’s the way these local businesses try to differentiate themselves from the national chains.  John’s Place is an excellent example of a relatively small enterprise (3 units in the Orange County, CA area) that is run well.

The menu at John’s is broader than most chain burger joints, and they feature several nice touches that separate them from the behemoths.  In addition to the usual (but in John’s case, very tasty) burgers and fries, they also have burritos and a variety of sandwiches, both cold (like tuna and ham) and hot (like pastrami, steak and gyros).  If you’d like, you can substitute onion rings or huge zucchini sticks for your fries.  And, they also have a soup and salad bar, as well as baklava for dessert.

Their breakfast menu goes beyond the typical fast food breakfast sandwiches and burritos; they also have egg platters, omelets, pancakes and French toast.  They also offer muffins and other baked treats from a local baker.  They have a large indoor seating area (all booths) as well as a well-maintained outdoor patio.

One thing I greatly admire about John’s ownership is their convictions – they play contemporary Christian music in the restaurant.  It’s certainly not intrusive; in fact, the volume is low enough that the music can be easily ignored.  But for those of us who recognize the music, it is greatly appreciated.

All in all, if you want a quick, hearty meal in a comfortable environment, you should definitely try John’s Place!

data.title: Get a cheeseburger. Visit Grandma. See the Wildlife of Tustin.
data.text:
JP's parking lot is at least two times as exciting as the menu. Always seems to be a cop in the drive-thru with a mean Dodge Charger. Last time was a woman cop. Fancy. Bus stop outside hosts a bevy of nature loving commuters. At 2am last Saturday as we rollerbladed the streets of Tustin (don't ask), I snapped iphone photos of two massive raccoons chatting it up on their hind legs like urban prairie dogs.

JP's best value item is a cheeseburger to go. Beats out any fast food joint.And I hear breakfast is not too shabby. My kids go out Saturday mornings for pancakes with Grandma while I sleep in.

I like the remodel, and I appreciate that you don't have to wait on a boring server, when all you really want to do is eat. Order at the counter and eat in peace. Outside seating by the fountain was extra credit, JP. Nice.
